transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Hi Michael, this is John Carter from CloudSync Solutions. We help growing teams streamline cloud storage and document collaboration. I saw that your company, NexaTech, has been expanding recently, and I wanted to see how you're currently managing your team's file-sharing and security.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 2
transcript.text: Hey John, thanks for reaching out. We're currently using Google Drive and Slack for most of our document sharing. It's working fine for now.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: That makes sense—Google Drive is a solid tool. A lot of our clients start there but run into issues as their teams scale. Things like version control, security concerns, and external sharing can get tricky. Have you faced any challenges in those areas?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 2
transcript.text: Well, permissions can be a hassle, especially when we work with external contractors. Sometimes, files get shared too broadly, and it's tough to track who has access to what.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: That's a common issue! CloudSync automates access control, so contractors only see what they need—without your team manually adjusting permissions each time. Plus, our system keeps a log of all file interactions for security compliance. Would that be useful for your team?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 2
transcript.text: It sounds interesting, but we're not actively looking for a new solution right now.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Totally understand! Just to give you more context, we recently helped a similar company reduce their document management time by 30%. I'd love to send over a short case study—would that be helpful?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 2
transcript.text: Sure, I can take a look.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Great! I'll email you the case study and a quick product video. How about a quick 15-minute call next Tuesday to answer any questions?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 2
transcript.text: Next Tuesday might be tight, but I could do Thursday afternoon.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Perfect! I'll send the details now and follow up on Thursday at 2 PM. Looking forward to it, Michael!
